fields.title: Google Chart Tools
fields.desc: Javascript API from Google to easily create visualization charts, also from real-time data.

fields.title: ScraperWiki
fields.desc: Community for the creation and reuse of data scrapers with support for Ruby, Python and PHP and free scraper and data hosting.

fields.title: Sunlight Labs
fields.desc: Project space of the Sunlight Foundation with a huge amount of hosted projects under an open source software licence beeing free for reuse.

fields.title: guardian.co.uk - Datablog
fields.desc: Datablog of the British Guardian covering new open data developments in Great Britain and the world.

fields.title: google-refine
fields.desc: Powerful tool from Google for cleaning up and transforming messy data.

fields.title: JavaScript InfoVis Toolkit
fields.desc: Javascript toolkit for creating data visualizations with support of various chart types.

fields.title: mySociety - github
fields.desc: Github account of mysociety.org with the source code of projects like fixmystreet or theyworkforyou.

fields.title: CKAN - the Data Hub Software
fields.desc: Open source software for publishing, sharing and finding data, used as a basis for many data catalogues.

fields.title: Apache Solr
fields.desc: Open source search platform with REST interface to realize fulltext search capability over large amounts of data.

fields.title: Apache Mahout
fields.desc: Apache software project with different scalable machine learning libraries in Java to get meaning out of data.

fields.title: Google docs - spreadsheets
fields.desc: Google tool to create and share structured data (spreadsheets) online, can be used in combination with other Google tools like Google Chart Tools or google-refine.

fields.title: Google Public Data Explorer
fields.desc: Online public dataset directory and tool to publish and visualize large datasets.

fields.title: Open Knowledge Foundation - github
fields.desc: Github account of the Open Knowledge Foundation (OKFN) with access to the source code of various OKFN projects.

fields.title: Greasemonkey
fields.desc: Firefox Add-on to execute own Javascript files in the browser, which can be used to realize screen scrapers in Javascript.

fields.title: d3.js - Data-Driven Documents
fields.desc: Small and very flexible open-source JavaScript library for manipulating documents based on data (e.g. to generate HTML5 or SVG charts from data).

fields.title: Ushahidi
fields.desc: Open source software for information collection, visualization and interactive mapping of location-based realtime data (e.g. from emergency situations, political elections, ...).

fields.title: Pachube
fields.desc: Service to create public or private API feeds from real-time data from sensors devices or environments, free and paid plans.

fields.title: elasticsearch
fields.desc: Distributed RESTful open source search engine for building search applications or add search to websites.

fields.title: 80Legs - Custom Web Crawlers
fields.desc: Service to create custom web crawlers to extract data from websites, free and paid plans.

fields.title: Wikipedia - Open Data
fields.desc: Open Data introduction on Wikipedia.

fields.title: OKFN - Open Definition
fields.desc: Website maintained by the Open Knowledge Foundation with a definition of Open in Open Data, Open Content and Open Services and information about usable licences to ensure openness.

fields.title: Google Correlate
fields.desc: Tool from Google to find searches that correlate with real-world data (e.g. correlation between searches like "how to treat the flu" and actual flu activity).

fields.title: OReilly - Open Government Book
fields.desc: Free first chapter "Government as a platform" from OReilly Book about open government.

fields.title: New York Times - Open Blog
fields.desc: Blog from New York Times developers about open data activities from the NYTimes and developments around open data.

fields.title: Sunlight Foundation - Sunlight Labs Blog
fields.desc: Developer blog by the Sunlight Foundation with news around Sunlight projects and open data projects and websites in the U.S..

fields.title: Open Knowledge Foundation Blog - Open Data
fields.desc: Open Data category from the blog of the Open Knowledge Foundation with recent open data news.

fields.title: OKFN - Open Data Manual
fields.desc: Manual maintained by the Open Knowledge Foundation discussing legal, social and technical aspects of Open Data.

fields.title: Google Fusion Tables
fields.desc: Data management tool from google to import, merge, publish, visualize and share data in the cloud.

fields.title: Eclipse BIRT
fields.desc: Reporting system for eclipse to create visually compelling reports from large amounts of data.

fields.title: Socrata
fields.desc: Open Data company providing a platform for institutions to publish and manage public data, used for many data catalogues.

fields.title: Open-Data-Catalog - github
fields.desc: Open source version of the code for OpenDataPhilly.org, the data catalogue for Philadelphia, PA.

fields.title: NY State Senate - Developers Network
fields.desc: Developers Network of the New York State Senate with information about APIs provided, source code used and contact possibilities.

fields.title: Froide - Github
fields.desc: Source code (Python/Django) for the German Freedom of Information request portal fragdenstaat.de - similar to whatdotheyknow.com - can be used as a basis for own FOI sites.

fields.title: DataMaps.eu - map your data
fields.desc: Tool for the creation of appealing map visualizations, which can be created within the website without programming knowledge.

fields.title: apileipzig - Github
fields.desc: Source code (Ruby) on Github used for the data api of the german city of Leipzig.

fields.title: Code for America - github
fields.desc: Github account of the U.S. organization "Code for America" with dozens of public repositories with open gov web solutions.

fields.title: Sunlight Foundation Blog
fields.desc: Blog of the U.S. non-profit Sunlight Foundation mainly covering U.S. open government news.

fields.title: World Bank - News | Data
fields.desc: Blog with news about the open data activities of the World Bank and related open data topics.
